jobs_results.title: Project Manager
jobs_results.description:
• No Recruitment Agencies. Direct Employer Only*

Responsibilities:
• Responsible for Project Management.
• Manage the Project completion on Time and to Expectations.
• Responsible for Project Deliverables - tracking, monitoring, forecasting & Reporting.
• Responsible for Project Execution & Implementation.
• Communication Management to all relevant stakeholders during project planning and execution.
• Coordinating the Project Requirements with other dept.
• Manage the Customer expectation during project implementation.
• Manage and update Project Documentation internally and client.
• Develop and manage the project execution plan and ensure that it is fully up to date and available to all stakeholders during the project lifecycle.
• Be the prime point of contact for the specific contracted projects.
• Manage contracted projects according to established procedures; these may vary according to the nature of the project, i.e. subsea telecom/power cable maintenance and installation.
•... Prime person responsible to ensure the project cost budget are achieved.
• Lead the onboard project team personnel to a common goal of successful project execution.
• Report on project performance internally (and externally as required) at frequent & regular intervals.
• Identify in advance any potential overruns in terms of cost or schedule, and take action to mitigate if required.
• Feed-back internally to the Lessons Learnt database.
• Measure and maintain KPI’s and ensure all stakeholders are fully aware and operate within these constraints.
• Communicate with Barge team to ensure the project execution meets the project requirements.
• Any other duties assigned by Senior Project Manager and/or Head, BU.

Requirements:-
• Bachelor’s degree required;
• Min 8 years of experience in project management, especially larger projects with established firms
• PMP certification preferred; PMO experience preferred
• Marine Construction or Offshore industry related experience preferred
• Experience in Agile teams
• Proven leadership skills
• Expertise in conflict resolution
• Analytical and strong organizational skills, with excellent verbal and written ability
• Proficiency with related software tools including but not limited to MS Excel, etc

jobs_results.title: Project Manager (IT Applications)
jobs_results.via: via Jobs In Singapore, Fresh Graduate Jobs For ITE Graduates ...
jobs_results.description:
Our client is a growing Fintech offering blockchain data analytics to their clients. They are looking for Project Manager to be part of forward-looking company!
In this role, you will manage the project for the implementation of the IT application system or services to ensure it meets the business operation goals.
• Responsible for the successful delivery of projects from end to end, ensuring the projects are completed on time, meeting requirements and within the budget
• Manage project lifescylce from end to end
• Involve in pre-project activities: project efforts, preparation of high-level project plan with project timeline and resource requirements, staffing and organization of the project team
• Plan, coordinate and communicate project plan, timeline and activities to the project team
• Monitor and track progress of the project and stay on top of the project to ensure smooth execution
• Understand customers' needs and manage their expectation to provide realistic expectation and... scope of the projects
• Work closely with vendors, business partners and all the parties involved in the projects

To be successful in this role, you should have
• Degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering
• 8 years of experience in managing IT projects and software/application development lifecycles
• Knowledge of development methodologies and implementation
• Experience in managing the entire SDLC using Agile/Waterfall software development practices
• CITPM or PMP certified
• Scrum certified
• Experience in leading cross-function teams
• Experience in managing vendors and partners
• Excellent in delivery management experience with proven track record in managing and steering projects smoothly and on-time delivery
• Problem solver and analytical thinker
• Understanding of Cloud Computing, Data Science/Machine Learning
• Open to work in fast-paced startup environment
• Singaporeans only

What's next?
If you are qualified and interested in applying for the position, please kindly send your CV in to Dam Dieu Phuong (Paula) at [Click Here to Email Your Resume] / Click Apply or call 65 6232 8832

jobs_results.title: Project Manager (Gaming Peripherals/ Audio hardwar... - Singapore
jobs_results.description:
Project Manager (Gaming Peripherals/ Audio hardware)

Location: Asia-Pacific - Singapore

BU/Function: Peripherals BU

Seniority: Manager & Professionals

Job Code: 1554

Job Responsibilities

You will be working within our Peripherals engineering team to plan, drive, lead the development of Razer's range of award winning peripherals hardware.
• Planning, overseeing and leading new product development (consumer electronics & furniture) delivered on time to the agreed quality standard and cost
• Responsible for the entire product development cycle, until it reaches the market, including hardware development, software development, packing design, testing & qualification, safety regulation and supply chain
• Leading project planning sessions, managing project progress and adapt work as required
• Ensuring projects meet deadlines, overseeing cost & all incoming and outgoing project documentation
• Conducting project review, optimizing and improving processes and the overall approach where... necessary

Pre-Requisites
• Diploma/Degree in Engineering or other related discipline
• Minimum 6 years project management experience in project manager, product development or engineering
• Experience in working with manufactures, supplier and external resources to achieve project goals
• Self-starter who has shown track records in delivering phenomenal products to the market
• Experience and good knowledge in hardware development, packing design, software development, testing & qualification, safety regulation and supply chain is an advantage
• Able to work in a fast paced environment independently and as a team
• Willing to travel for business
• Preferably with related experience in consumer electronics and furniture industry
• Able to speak Mandarin and PMP certification is an advantage

jobs_results.title: Project Manager
jobs_results.description:
Position: Project Manager, Salary up to $6,500
Job Description The job responsibilities for Project Manager are as follows:

Responsible for overall project life cycle in managing all project activities right from project initiation phase to project implementation until successful system commissioning Assist the users in preparing Specific Operational

Requirements (SOR) and translate these requirements to technical requirements and specifications in Tender document. In addition, the Project Manager shall work closely with User to seek project funding approval from higher management Perform front end study, risk assessment and proposed technical solutions to meet User Operational needs. Perform the necessary Request for Information (RFI) and submit budget proposal Prepare the necessary procurement documentation for project Tenders.

Evaluate the Tenders and write evaluation reports to recommend for Tender award. Manage contracts with the relevant vendors to ensure prompt deliveries of... services / products and address renewals of contracts and payments to the vendors, as well as to ensure the availability of funds for such payments. Preparation of Project Management Plan, project related technical document and management reports.

Lead, manage and execute project tasks within the approved scope, schedule and budget Manage the acceptance tests to ensure that the system requirements and specifications are met in accordance with contractual requirements. Prepare and submit Project Monthly Progress Report. Report project progress status to the Deputy Director / Head (Joint Capabilities) and HTD/User Management at regular project meetings. The Project Manager shall highlight project issues (including risks) and proposed mitigation plans and follow-up actions.

Manage the users’ expectations and resolve any project issues timely. Manage contractors and ensure project scope of work is fulfilled according to contractual requirements. Manage all project deliverables until completion of delivery to User. Work closely with contractor and external government agencies for all project related works. Moreover, the Project Manager must work seamlessly with other cross functional teams and units to resolve project matters taking into account security, system integration and interoperability.

Able to work and think independently with minimum supervision Assist user in the preparation of guidelines and standard operating procedures (SOPs) related to the systems. Conduct training for users of the proposed systems and solutions. Keep abreast of new technology developments in Video Surveillance Provide technical consultation (i.e. market research and feasibility studies) to Users on new technologies Manage projects to ensure smooth transition to warranty / maintenance phase.

Work with the vendors, users and relevant parties to ensure systems in warranty or maintenance phase are functioning and performing to specifications. In event of system failure or non-performance to specification, the Project Manager shall work with the vendors to recover or reinstate the system to its operational states or functionalities in the shortest possible time. Perform any other duties as assigned by HTX Senior Management or Director (Joint Capabilities)

Requirements:

Degree/Diploma in Electronics/ Electrical Engineering/Computer Studies, or other Engineering.
• Have preferably 2 years working experiences in managing large scale ICT, or engineering projects preferably with involvement throughout the entire project lifecycle Have relevant experiences in working on large scale systems that are deployed at multiple sites Have prior experiences in managing and coordinating multiple vendors so as to integrate multiple deliveries / systems from various vendors into a functioning large scale system.

Goodworking knowledge and experience in one or more of the following areas:

Infrastructure Construction to support ICT equipment (e.g. Structures, Electrical, Network Installation, Wireless Transmission, etc ) Cloud Technology The Candidate shall possess excellent Project Management skill, good Systems Engineering knowledge; and understand the concept of Integrated Logistic Support & System Life Cycle.

Able to be contactable 24 x 7 and support operations after office hours, on weekends and Public Holidays if required Preferably be a Certified IT Project Manager, Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Information Technology Project Manager (CITPM) or equivalent practitioner Project Management experiences

jobs_results.title: Infrastructure Security Project Manager at NCS Group
jobs_results.description:
Infrastructure Security Project Manager at NCS Group

Job Description

Primary Purpose 1. Manage, define and implement IT infrastructure security projects and the quality and progress of these projects to ensure on time, effective project outcomes. Responsibilities: 1. As project manager, manage infrastructure security deployment projects involving security solutions such as firewalls, intrusion prevention/detection systems, VPN, authentication, content filtering, anti-virus, patch management, data loss prevention, SIEM, etc. 2. To ensure the project tasks are monitor, track and complete on time and negotiate with the customer if there is any delay or/and gaps 3. Manage internal project team members and external vendor or/and partners 4. Responsible for the project P&L, financial forecast and ensure the cost is within the budgeted cost The ideal candidate should possess: 1. Preferably a degree in IT equivalent qualifications with experience as project manager position in the SI... industry 2. At least 5 yearsâ€™ experience in project management roles. Experience as a technical lead in migration projects, which involve security, LAN/WAN and servers. 3. Knowledge or experience in firewall, IPS, IDS, VPN, authentication, anti-virus, content filtering, patch management, cloud security, web & database security, data loss prevention & SIEM is a plus point 4. Knowledge or experience in LAN internetworking, including hubs, switches, load-sharing equipment and bandwidth optimizers is a plus point 5. Knowledge or experience in OS-hardening, UNIX and Window platforms is a plus point 6. PMP certification is required 7. CISSP certification is preferred. 8. Nationality: Singaporean or PR 9. Excellent interpersonal, presentation, writing and communication skill 10. Highly motivated and willing to learn new technologies and able to work under pressure 11. Successful track record of managing (large size / complex) IT security solution implementation projects 12. Distinct ability to communicate technology effectively and manage many security domains tracks 13. Good project management skills Show more

Original Joblink : https://sg.linkedin.com/jobs/view/infrastructure-security-project-manager-at-ncs-group-2486263081

Google Company: https://www.google.com/search?q=Infrastructure%20Security%20Project%20Manager%20at%20NCS%20Group

jobs_results.title: AGILE Program/Project MANAGER (INSURANCE| MNC BANK | CONTRACT
jobs_results.description:
PURPOSE
• To lead a medium to the large project team of internal and/or external resources to deliver specified program/project within agreed parameters.
• Projects likely to be complex so will involve significant benefit/risk to the organization.
• Projects may be stand-alone within a portfolio or may comprise a Workstream within the overall company program.
• Will take a leadership position within the division and within the organization.
• Responsibility to supervise and motivate project groups working in an agile environment, to enable them to complete assigned tasks within a set time, and to deliver top performance.

DUTIES
• Assist the Head of Project and Programme Management to build the execution and delivery capability in accordance with the organization's project management methodology and standards.
• Assist the Head of Project and Programme Management in ensuring the organization's governance framework is adhered to.
• Assist Department heads to develop Investment... Feasibility for initiatives that have been agreed upon as part of the organization's roadmap.
• Develop and actively manage project plans in line with the organization's standards to ensure solutions are delivered within agreed parameters.
• Manage projects/portfolio to plan to take appropriate corrective action to ensure delivery remains on track.
• Manage the project spend within the approved budget.
• Work across multiple division/departments and are responsible for assigning work and getting the status of the work completed.
• Interact with company clients and understand their requirements.
• Determining project requirements and developing work schedules for the team.
• Manage relationships across all business lines, global technical teams, and with external parties, defining requirements, agreeing on terms, and ensuring delivery in accordance with the agreed timeline.
• Plan and manage internal and external project resources to ensure delivery of project outputs within agreed parameters.
• Assist in team development by removing roadblocks to their work, mentoring them, and making good utilization of organizational resources to improve capacity for project work.
• Minimize exposure and risks by identifying and proactively managing, i.e., mitigation, financial and operating risks and issues affecting the project.
• Develop, prepare, and deliver Management Information and reports regularly to support decision-making.
• Provide prompt progress updates and communications.
• Assist with the management of resources (people, budget, technological) to ensure the division delivers the complete program of work to the organization.

EXPERIENCE
• At least 8 years of experience in the financial services/insurance industry
• At least 5 years relevant experience at the Project Manager level with a demonstrable record of success
• Experience in Governance and Insurance
• Knowledge in IT would be good to have.

EDUCATION / TRAINING
• Degree or any related discipline

PROFESSIONAL / TRADE QUALIFICATION
• Agile certification
• Project Management certifications like PMP and Prince2 would be good to have.

COMPUTER PROFICIENCY
• Advanced Microsoft Office suite including MS Project and MS Visio
• JIRA and Confluence

Mary Grace Perez Marcojos EA License No. 02C3423 Personnel Registration No. R1110449

jobs_results.title: IT Project Manager ( Scrum Certified/Agile)
jobs_results.description:
:
• Jumpstart new Agile projects by helping clients to understand Agile and onboard key roles.
• Work closely with project leadership to assess organisational impediments, measure flow and develop strategies for continuously improving.
• Implement processes, practices, and tools to allow for multiple paths of delivery. For e.g, create simplified, consistent, reusable, efficient and flexible methodologies.
• Play an active role in mentoring agile teams and guide them in project implementation.
• Serve as a Coach and Mentor within the organization to facilitate adoption and maturity.
• Lead and influence others including those more senior on best practices.
• Inspire others to adopt the new processes and improvements based on program retrospectives.

Pre-requisites
• At least five (5) to eight (8) years of experience in managing Projects in an Agile environment.
• Project Management experience.
• Completed at least 1 Agile project as a Scrum Master.
• Attained the Certified Scrum Master... or an equivalent qualification.
• Good knowledge of the commonly used agile tools and practices.
• Team player, Supervisory, Coaching, planning, and management skills.
• Possesses strong customer empathy.
• Possesses good oral and written communication skills in English.

Please send in your resume in MS Word format to [Click Here to Email Your Resume]

jobs_results.title: Project Manager (Engineering| Functional| Jurong)
jobs_results.description:
Project Manager (Engineering| Functional| Jurong)

Job Summary
The Project Manager shall serve as a primary interface by providing a single point of contact between the company and customer/sales and to act for and on behalf of company.
The Project Manager shall be responsible for the effective management and delivery of equipment and services as defined by customers order with respect to safety, quality, cost and schedule requirements of the project.

Support the upfront pre-tender / tender phase by providing input such as lessons learnt, challenges, risks and/ or opportunities to the proposal/costing team.
• Responsible for implementing client requirements and contractual obligations are
made known and understood by all personnel involved with the project execution
• Produce project deliverables in a safe manner, to specifications and quality
requirements, on schedule and within budget
• Responsible for leading a cross functional team (Planners, buyers, engineers,
manufacturing) and... ensuring they can meet the obligations of the contract/project
• Coordinate with various functional departments to support the project
• Comprehends contractual conditions and specifications and looks for commercial and
technical cost savings.
• Ensures resources are deployed where applicable.
• Communicates with other managers to ensure accurate information is made available
at all times to facilitate effective decision-making.
• Performs & Manages Risks: Identifies problem areas, evaluates and initiates corrective
action, monitors and reschedules the project schedule with respect of time and
required resources.
• Maintains a record of all communications related to the project.
• Work with Project Accountant to develop and present financial performance reports
and project P&L statements.
• Monitors project performance against an agreed plan and budget and initiates
corrective action where appropriate to ensure projects are completed on time and
within budget.
• Performs Management of Change: Identifies and records changes to the project scope
of supply and negotiates/document variation orders for customer driven changes and
advice all concerned of the impact on cost, manpower and schedule.
• Creates a project schedule and maintains for the duration of the project
• Maintains action items registers for the project
• Advises plants on invoicing for milestone payments at attainment and maintains the
schedule for milestone payment invoicing.
• Creates/Estimates revenue forecast documents for the duration of the project.
• Provides internal project reporting by using monthly dashboards, and project
reviews as needed
• Provides external project reporting as defined by the customer in project
specifications.
• Completes all project closeout activities including evaluation of project performance,
documenting lessons learnt, archiving and close out report.

Minimum Job Qualifications :
• Bachelor Degree in Engineering preferred
• Minimum 3years in Oil & Gas industry or other relevant industry experience
• Knowledge of project management principles with specific experience managing projects.
• Proven leadership experience with the ability to plan, organize and execute.
• A good working knowledge of production and inventory control systems

Qualifications:

Project Management Professional (PMP) certified would be an advantage

Others

Computer literate: Microsoft Office, Project Management Software, SAP knowledge is a plus
Ability to take night calls due to worldwide customers/ stakeholders
Proactive/ independent learner
Possess strong communication skills

If you have the releavnt skillsets, please send an updated CV in word format to sherry.[Click Here to Email Your Resume].

We shall contact shortlisted candidates.

Ng Yew Koon Sherry
Senior Recruitment Consultant (R1657259)

jobs_results.title: Jooble - Project Manager (Retail Engineer)
jobs_results.description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Project Manager (Retail Engineer), who is/are able to fulfill the following requirements:
Duration: 12 Months
Requirements:
- Project management experience in software engineering. Past hands-on development experience.
- PMP certification and prior experience of managing e-Commerce projects is a plus.
- Have technical background, with hands-on background in software development and web technologies.
- Experience in object-oriented programming (e.g., JAVA) is required.
- Technically astute and skilled to understand complex issues and participate in discussions with the engineering teams. Be a recognized SME both technically and functionally for the platform.
Roles and Responsibilities:
- To lead a complex multi-functional engineering projects and serve as primary point-of-contact for end-to-end coordination and execution.
- You are responsible for taking the idea from conception to implementation, as well as provide post- production support and... define success metrics.
- You will be expected to define the technical requirements, run project schedules, handle project budget, identify risks, and communicate project progress to stakeholders.
- Contribute to and involvement in all phases of software development lifecycle: requirements gathering, analysis, system design, development, testing, deployment, warranty, and post-production support.
- Build detailed and feasible project plans to achieve objectives and track project progress.
- Work with various partners to understand business requirements and help define a high-level solution. Handle project scope while ensuring technical feasibility.
- Ensure quality and security standards are met by the project.
- Be comfortable with both waterfall and agile methodologies.
- You are expected to establish and drive solutions for business requirements, taking ownership for their success – both as part of project delivery and for business outcomes.
- Additionally, define the functional solution considering the business requirements and priorities and balance those against the schedule and technical landscape to implement the best solution.
- You will need to be an experienced, results-oriented technical individual who has a track record of defining and implementing web-based commerce solutions.
Please send your application to View email address on monster.com.sg with (JOB_002262) in Subject line and highlighting:
- Your relevant experience
- Current/expected salary
- Availability information
- A latest MS-WORD Resume

jobs_results.title: IT Project Manager
jobs_results.description:
Job Description
• Manage a variety of complex, cross-functional programs and lead all aspects of assigned programs delivery.
• As a PM, you’ll be the bridge between Business and Engineering, by working between clients and software engineers.
• Create and maintain the Delivery Roadmap for the clients you work closely with, along with the respective solutions architects.
• Define the way of driving these programs and constantly find ways of improving this process in a data driven manner. Owners of the collaboration process and tools.

Responsibilities
• General Project management - Prepare project timelines, define milestones, track and report progress, conflict management and resolution.
• Documents project objectives and ensures they meet expected business results/outcome.
• Communicates regularly and effectively with management on project progress.
• Produce and maintain key project documentation throughout the project lifecycle (i.e. plans, status reports, issue and risk logs).
•... Serves as single point of contact for all project management related questions and refers technical questions to solutions architects and ensures timely follow ups.
• Work with cross functional teams of Solutions Architects, Lead Developers, Remote developers and QA to ensure on time delivery.
• Continuously find ways to help teams and the organisation improve how it delivers.

Skills and Qualifications
• University Graduate with Degree in Business/Computer Science/Information Systems/Arts and Social Sciences preferred but not limited to.
• Certification in project management and/or Agile (Product Owner or Scrum Master) methodologies would be advantageous.
• Able to create and conduct formal presentations.
• Able to adjust readily to change and adapt as needed.
• Able to express ideas clearly and convey necessary information.
• Able to think strategically and tactically. Able to be attentive and foster two-way conversation.
• Possesses strong organizational and time management skills, driving tasks to completion.
• Able to use relevant computer system applications (which may include spreadsheets, word processors, databases, etc).
• SQL experience, able to interpret, understand & analyze data schemes and data sets would be advantageous.
• Able to constructively work under stress and pressure when faced with high workloads and deadlines
